item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Fol. 1 missing. Two folios between fol. 5 and 7, numbered "drug gong ma" and "drug."
Folio number on last folio: nye gnyis bzhugs so
Orthography:
- Palatalization of m (e.g., dmyigs), but not systematic
- Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers
- Additional 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., dpe', dgu')
- the tsom for the tshom
- chu.ngu (or chung_ngu?) for chung ngu
- b frequently not closed on the top (looking like p) where b is expected (e.g., byang chub)
- Space used with the value of shad
- A few abbreviations (e.g., for thams cad, sems can)
- In the interlinear notes, Na for myed
Interlinear notes referring to the Tibetan translation of the base text and some glosses in cursive script (notably, indicating the absence of a corresponding commentary). A number of insertions (corrections). On fol. 15a, a few insertions in dbu can, e.g., fols. 13b, 15a.

comments:
There are two sets of images for this manuscript, which differ in legibility.
On the provenance of the manuscript, see [S635TW6P]: 61 and [WLWGS439]: n. 90.

Following the colophon, one finds the first four verses of Vinītadeva’s
Samayabhedoparacanacakra explaining the division of Buddhist schools into 18.

comments:
This instance contains work (ID:5045) (fols. 1-2b6), followed by work (ID:5049) (fols. 2b6 to 15a7.
The main text of work (ID:5049) alternates with glosses, and the author of the glosses added two lines after the colophon, mentioning having studied mind training for three years.
The signature number is unclear and the reading "182" is tentative. There is no entry with the signature number "la 182" in [8H6M69W4].

name: brgyad stong 'grel chen gyi bshad pa
provenance: 'bras spungs sgo mang grwa tshang gi dpe mdzod khang
item_description:
Xylograph (shing dpar).
Numbers 84 and 85 appear on the same folio.
Folio numbering in letters in the left margin on the recto (on the verso on f. 1), mostly in dbu can. A few numbers are written in dbu med (e.g., 34 on fol. 34b and 35 on fol. 35a). Arabic numbers in the left margin up to 32 and on fol. 40 and some later folios, in the right margin on other folios (12 on f. 12b, 2* on f. 29b, 32 on f. 34b, 3* on f. 34a, 35 on f. 35b, 4 on 41b, 4 on 43b, 4 on 45b, 4 on 46b, 4 on 47b, 50 on f. 50b, 51 on 51b, 52 on 52a, 5* on f. 53a, 54 on f. 54a, 5* on 55b, 57 on 57b), as well and Tibetan cursive numerals are probably a recent addition.
Folio number on last folio: gya bzhi gya lnga gc(ig go)
Lines per folio: 7; 3 on f. 84 and 85b.
Orthography:
- particle pa/ba takes the form ba after final –n
- orthographic variants (e.g., the tsom for the tsom)
Rare interlinear additions (e.g., fol. 8a7, fol. 12a1, fol. 12b1).
Occasional burring (e.g., fol. 20b, fol. 62b) and fading (e.g., fol. 26b).

According to a post-colophon annotation, copied from a "master exemplar" (reading "phyag dpe dngos las bris" for "phyag dpe dngos la bris") - i.e., (ID: 5856) or a copy of it - or itself constituting the master exemplar.
The part entitled "bslab btus kyi bsgom don dpe'i khrid zab po" covers fols. 1b1-2b1, and the part entitled "spyod 'jug 'khro lo ta bu zab lam bsgom pa" covers fol. 2b1-7b2.

comments:
Incomplete manuscript with misplaced folios. Fols. 1b-199b and 226a-228b correspond to fols. 1b-228b in (ID:4467), and fols. 200a-225b to fols. 229a-254b in (ID:4467). See [A629CP5J]: 15-17.
The text in this instance presents numerous variants compared to that of the other dbu med manuscript (ID:4467) and of the block-print (ID:7189).
This item is not listed in [8H6M69W4], which does not have any entry between "la 186" to and "la 202." A seal and modern catalogue number 20(265) appear on the cover page.

comments:
Manuscript from gNas bcu lha khang without a visible signature (<<bKa' gdams gsung 'bum dkar chag [S635TW6P]>>: 76 "dpe rtags med pa").
In view of the number of folios, this item might be identical with (ID:5939), listed as No. 15550 in the <<'Bras spungs dpar chag [8H6M69W4]>>, but the latter is reported to have the signature "phyi tsa 65."

On fol. 2a5, one finds an invocation to 'Jam dbyang mgon po after 8 shads and two siddham signs. 
After the colophon, an unidentified work starts on fol. 6b5 with an invocation to Nāgārjuna.
alternative_names: byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi' brgya pa'i dka ba'i gnas bshad pa (colophon)
name: byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi' brgya pa'i dka' ba'i gnad bshad pa
item_description:
(From research project [M3J8XFVK])
Script: 'bru tsha.
Folio numbering mostly not visible or legible. In the left margin of fol. 5: pan tsa (=Skt. pañca) in addition to lnga. In the left margin of fol. 2: du spo (?) above gnyis (only "i" being visible).
The text starts on the recto of the first folio (no cover page).
Lines per folio: 14; 16 on fol. 6b.
Orthography:
- Numerals used for numbers 
- Frequent abbreviations (e.g., for thams cad, nyon mongs, etc.)
- Frequent additional suffix –’a (e.g., dpe’)
- Alternative prefixes (e.g., rngos or sngos for dngos)
- Bindu for m
- Always a tsheg before shad (or double shad)
Heavily annotated in the margins and between the lines.
The bottom part of the last line on fol. 4a, 5a, and 6a has been cut off in the reproduction.

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Folio numbered with letters (only ga, cha and ja are visible).
Lines per folio; 11; 10 on fol. 6b; 8 on fol. 7a.
Orthography: 
- Abbreviations (e.g., for slob dpon, thams cad, final –gs, etc.)
- Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin)
- Frequent broken shad ( ¦ ) 
- Alternative prefixes (e.g., rngos for dngos)
- la rtsogs pa for la sogs pa
- ṇa (reversed form of na) for med
- Tibetan numerals used for numbers (e.g. 2 po for gnyis po)
Several annotations (corrections as well as glosses).

item_description:
Script: dbu med ('bru tsha), with some additions in dbu can.
Archaic features (da-drags, palatalization of m before vowel) and fluctuating orthography (e.g., bzhan for gzhan).
According to the editors: incomplete, but the numbering of the folio shows no interruption. However, there is no image of fol. 1a (the cover page).
According to the colophon: "Written as it was taught/recited by Dar ma rdo rje  (ID:6553)" (fol. 15a3-4: byang chub seMs dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa {*}'i bsdus don shag kya'i dge slong chos kyi seng ges sbyar ba las | rigs par smra ba'i dge' slong dar ma rdo rjes gsung ba ltar (15a4) bris pa 'di yongs su rdzogs s+ho || )

The number on the last two folios is not visible. In the set of images in [WD872RQ5], the number "160" has been written over the faded and partly damaged folio number written in letters. It has not been determined whether folios are missing between fol. 154, the next folio, and the folio ending with the colophon.

name: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Numbering in letters in the left margin on the recto, only visible on fol. 2, fol. 3 and fol. 7
Orthography:
- Use of bindu for m
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed) with some exceptions
- Particle pa/ba sometimes takes the form pa after final –ng
- Rare superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., gzhi')
Lemmas of the base text as sublinear notes.

name: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa
item_description:
Two folios (1 and 5), labeled Ka and Ca, are extant out of 5 folios.
Letter in the left margin (folio numbering): ka.
Marginal annotation by another hand on top of the first folio: spyod 'jug gi sdus don yin he he | sngog glo ldan she rab ba ||
Colophon, fol. 5b4: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa || lo tsa ba blo ldan shes rab gyis sbyar ba'o || 'di'i dpe' lo tsa ba rang gis tha mas bcos pa la bri || || bag res dal nas 'da' lags || rdzogs s+h+yo || || I th+yi || ||
Two lines in another script at the bottom of the folio (writing exercise) are not related to the text.

comments: Marginal glosses identify a number of figures referred to anonymously in the main text, notably rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786), Zangs dkar lo tsA ba (ID:3944), Zhang Tshes spong (ID:3805) and 'Bre Shes rab 'bar (ID:3807).

name: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i tshig don gsal bar bshad pa
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Fol. 4 missing.
Orthography:
- Palatalization of m (not systematic)
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (gtso' bo, rgyu', brjod bya')
- Alternative prefixes r- for d- (rgos for dgos), 'a- for m- ('khan for mkhan), also for the numbers in the margins (e.g. rgu' for dgu)
- Alternative orthography (yon gtan, bder gshegs)
- Fluctuant orthography (bstan bcos and bstan chos)
- Bindu for m
- Abbreviations (e.g., for ye shes)
Numerous interlinear and marginal glosses and corrections by erasing and insertion, more abundant in the beginning; annotations by several hands (cf. insertion in dbu can on ff. 29a, 82b)

comments:
No signature visible on the reproduction in [Z5AUD7GQ]. [S635TW6P]: 93 reports "phyi dza 18."
[8H6M69W4] reports 226 folios, which is one of the folio numbers on the last folio.

The colophon is followed by a discussion on the necessity to mention the text name at the beginning of a work.
alternative_names:
byang chub sems dpa' yi bslabs pa kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad (colophon)
byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad rin chen sgron me (catalogue)
name: byang chub sems dpa' yi bslabs pa kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad
item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
196 folios are extant.
No folio with No. 90, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 89 and fol. 91.
Two folios are numbered 125 between fol. 124 and fol. 126.
No folio with No. 128, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 127 and fol. 129.
Between fol. 151 and 154, one folio numbered 152-53.
No folio with No. 170, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 169 and fol. 171.
No folio with No. 180, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 179 and fol. 181.
Fol. 187 is numbered "187-8."
The folio between fol. 187 and fol. 190 is numbered 188-89.
No folio with No. 190, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 188-89 and fol. 191.
After fol. 197, two sets of folio numbers. The second continues with 198, 199, etc. up to 202. The first with 198-99, 199', 201 'og ma, 202 gong ma, 226. It is yet to be ascertained whether there are gaps in the text between the folios. 
The text starts on fol. 1a (no cover page)
Use of abbreviations.
Some longer glosses have been written within the main text, indicating that they were copied together with the main text.
Glosses identify scholars whose views are referred to in the main text.
The glosses are only found in some sections.

For the signature number, only "7" is visible on the image in the <<bKa' gdams gsung 'bum [Z5AUD7GQ]>> reproduction. The editors also report the signature as "phyi tsa 7" (<<bKa' gdams gsung 'bum dkar chag [S635TW6P]>>: 65). 
<<'Bras spungs dkar chag [8H6M69W4]>>: No. 15516 lists an item with a corresponding title, authorship and number of folios, but reports the signature "phyi tsa 57." This might be an error, or the item is a different manuscript.

According to <<Kramer 2007 [Q47PVAE6]>>: 16, n. 4, the copy in [Z5AUD7GQ] appears to be a second exemplar with identical length and title as the Beijing CPN copy (non-accessible).

item_description:
Script: dbu can.
Lines per folio: 6; 7 on fol. 86, 5 on fol. 9a.
Orthography:
- Occasional abbreviations (e.g., for so sor, 'phul lo, gnyis su, las kyi)
- Bindu used a few times for final –m
A few short insertions (corrections). Long insertion of a missing passage in the bottom margin on fol. 5a.
Proofread once.
Indigenous catalogue marking: 3(9?)8 on cover page.

comments: Contains a colophon indicating a copy by Ze'u (ID:6458) and an addition in smaller script specifying the location of scribing. We understand the colophon to be copied from a previous instance (ID:5855) and the place of copy being that of a the present instance. Possibly, the addition in smaller script is giving the location of the copy by Ze'u, in which case there would be no need to postulate (ID:5855) different from (ID:4847).

relations.label: dbu ma bden gnyis kyi don bsdus (4480) has as an instance dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus (4479)

obj.label: dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus (4479)

comments:
This 4-folio "don bsdus" follows the "rnam bshad" (ID: 5875) on the same manuscript with continuous folio numbering, but the signature phyi tsa 120 is repeated on fol. 34.
The <<'Bras spungs dkar chag [8H6M69W4]>> has a unique entry for both the "don bsdus" and the "rnam bshad" (No. 15724: dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus; phya pa chos kyi seng ge; 'bru tsha; 37f; 66.5 x 9.8cm).
alternative_names: dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus (colophon)
name: dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Orthography:
- Rare use of bindu for m
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –ng and ba after final –n (not systematic)
- mngon gsum for mngon sum
- Occasional superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., dpe')
- Numeral used for number (once)
Volume letter: Ga

relations.label: dbu ma bden gnyis kyi rnam bshad (5874) has as an instance dbu ma bden pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yi ge nyung ngus gzhung gsal bar byed pa (5875)

obj.label: dbu ma bden pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yi ge nyung ngus gzhung gsal bar byed pa (5875)

comments:
This 44-folio "rnam bshad" is followed by a "bsdus don" (ID: 4479) with continuous folio numbering, but the signature phyi tsa 120 is repeated on fol. 34 (where the bsdus don begins). 
The <<'Bras spungs dkar chag [8H6M69W4]>> has a single entry for both the "rnam bshad" and the "bsdus don" (No. 15724: dbu ma bden pa gnyis kyi don bsdus; phya pa chos kyi seng ge; 'bru tsha; 37f; 66.5 x 9.8cm).
alternative_names: dbu ma bden pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yi ge nyung ngus gzhung gsal bar byed pa (colophon)
name: dbu ma bden pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yi ge nyung ngus gzhung gsal bar byed pa
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
No title on the cover page.
Volume letter: Ga
Orthography:
- Rare use of bindu for m
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –ng and final -r
- Alternative prefix r- for l- (e.g., rkog du gyur)
- lasogs pa for la sogs pa
- Enclitic particles 'ang, 'am sometimes written as separate syllables

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
First folio missing (replaced in [Z5AUD7GQ] by a dbu can typeset transcription based on (ID:6818)).
Folios 29a and 33a, although extant, are replaced in [Z5AUD7GQ] by a typeset transcription, but are visible in another set of images of the same manuscript on BUDA (http://purl.bdrc.io/resource/WA23505).
Lines per folio: 7; 4 on fol. 57a (plus a line of five double shad and a post-colophon note)
Orthography:
- Use of bindu for m
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –ng
- A few abbreviations (e.g., ye shes, thams cad)
Rare marginal and interlinear annotation (corrections)

name: dbu ma rgyan gyi 'grel pa rgya cher bshad pa (1)
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 8; 2 on ol. 43b (plus a line with six double shad)
Folio numbering in letters on the recto from fol. 2a.
Volume letter: Kha (the manuscript was part of a 3-fold bundle containing also (ID:5875) and presumably (ID:7280))
Orthography:
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –ng and ba after final –n
- Particle tu/du takes the form du after final -b (e.g., rab du)
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., dge', rgya mtsho')
- Variant spelling (e.g., phun sum 'tshogs, the tsom, log rtogs)
Incipit (from "bla ma dam pa") originally written in colored ink (apart from the vowels and shad) appears faded on the black and white reproduction. Lemmata highlighted with color.
Some interlinear and marginal notes.

comments:
Block-print (dbu can) prepared by 'Jam dbyangs mkhyen brtse'i dbang po at sDe dge par khang and published by Dharma chakra center in 1975 (BDRC, bdr:MW14060).
The work colophon (fol. 155a3-155a5) is followed by the print colophon (fol. 155a5-156a6).
Another print (likely from the same woodblock in view of the number of folios) was filmed by the NGMPP (L/222/1) in 1989 in the collection of Sangye Tenzin Lama in Serlog Gompa, Solokhumbu, Junbesi. The size of the folios is reported to be: 10 x 56 cm (http://purl.bdrc.io/resource/MW0NGMCP47220, https://catalogue.ngmcp.uni-hamburg.de/receive/aaingmcp_tbtdocument_00047220)

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha
First folio missing. The signature is written on the top of f. 2a.
Interlinear notes (including corrections) in dbu med and dbu can.
It seems that the manuscript was copied from an exemplar with interlinear notes identifying persons mentioned without a name, and that these identifications were integrated into the main text (e.g. f. 19a8: dngon gyi slob dpon dbyig gnyen 'ga' zhig).

comments:
Title reported in [8H6M69W4]: No. 15677: dbu ma'i yig cha phya pas byas pa.
The 82-folio manuscript with the signature "tsa 107" reported in [HMSTSJ7Q]: 71, with the colophon corresponding to that of the dBu ma snang ba'i 'grel pa (ID:4882) might correspond to this instance, or to instance (ID:7281), the title of which is also reported as "dbu ma'i yig cha" in [8H6M69W4]: No. 15668.
alternative_names:
dbu ma snang ba'i gzhung gi don rigs pa'i tshul dang myi 'gal zhing blo chung bas kyang bde blag du rtogs pa byis pa'i 'jug ngos (sic) su sbyar ba (colophon)
dbu ma'i yig cha phya pas byas pa'o (cover page)
phywa pa chos seng ges mdzad pa'i dbu ma snang ba'i 'grel pa
name: dbu ma snang ba'i 'grel pa
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 8; 2 on fol. 82b.
Folio numbering in letters on the recto from fol. 2.
Number of the last folio: gya gnyis bzhugs so.
Orthography: 
Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed) with few exceptions
- Use of inversed i
- Particle pa/ba sometimes takes the form ba after final -n, and after final -r
- Particle kyi is found after final -l, -n, -r and -s
- Particle tu/du takes the form du after final -g and tu after final -n
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug is not used except on a few occasions that have been corrected (e.g., fol. 1a)
- Enclitic particles such as 'ang appear as separate syllable (with some exceptions)
- Alternative spelling (the tsom for the tshom)
- Tsheg always present before shad
- Abbreviation ṇa for med
Often leaves a large space before shad.
On fol. 2a, l. 8 seems to have written by a different hand up to “nas bslang ba lus kyis,” idem on fol. 2b1, up to “de las chos kyis” and on 3a8 up to “de lta na.” 
Blurring on top left of fol. 1b and fol. 4b, left extremity of fol. 2a, etc.
A few marginal annotations and interlinear annotations, more numerous around fols. 29-32.

There is no matching entry in the [8H6M69W4], which lists six texts with the signature “phyi tsha 116,” all of which are related to the Abhisamayālaṅkāra (ID: 3706) and not to the Madhyāntavibhāga (ID:3748).

item_description:
Lines per folio: 9; 7 on fol. 13a.
Numbering of folios in numerals on fols. 2–4 and in letters on fols. 5–12 (preceded by an illegible character on 5 and 5, maybe a numeral?) on the recto of the folios.
Orthography:
-  Extensive use of abbreviations (e.g., for thun mong, shes rab, 'jig rten, bdag nyid, phun sum tshogs etc.) (number increasing as the text goes)
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin)
- ṇa for med
- Additional b- prefixes (e.g., bsgrub, bston)
- Alternative prefix b- for g- (e.g., rnam par bzhag pa)
A few interlinear corrections and some glosses (e.g., fol. 4b9), in two different hands.

obj.label: dka' gnas rnam par bshad pa (4444)

comments:
This manuscript corresponds to the 132-folio manuscript with signature "phyi zha 83 (sic, for 43)" reported in <<van der Kuijp 1994 [4TBERVZD]>>: 6 to have been preserved at the Cultural Palace of Nationalities in Beijing (CPN), No. 5139(1). It was relocated to Se ra dgon pa'i dpe mdzod khang (<<bKa' gdams gsung 'bum dkar chag [S635TW6P]>>: 47). In view of the signature, it was originally part of the 'Bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang collection. [8H6M69W4] does not list any item with the signature "phyi zha 43."
This seems to be the manuscript listed in the catalogue of the Theg chen gling seminary ([HMSTSJ7Q]: 269 (gdan sa chen po se ra), No. 711: ka 422, lo chen gyis mdzad pa'i rnam nges ti ka, lo chen blo ldan shes rab, khyugs tshugs, 132 fols., 67x9cm.) ([FEHIEFEB]: 112, n. 3). 

The [8H6M69W4] does not list any item with the signature "phyi zha 43."

In the [Z5AUD7GQ], the text from the ca. 10 missing folios following fol. 132 has been supplemented on pp. 683-706 as dbu can typeset transcription based on another manuscript, i.e. instance (ID:5966).

name: dka' gnas rnam par bshad pa
provenance:
'bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang
CPN 5139(1)
se ra dgon
item_description:
Size according to the Theg chen gling catalogue ([HMSTSJ7Q]: 269, no. 711: ka 422).
The mention “1(132)” is visible on the left of the cover page.
A number of interlinear and marginal notes (corrections and glosses), often faded and/or illegible on the image. In the bottom left corner of the last folio (132b), illegible note written in the sense of the margin (** lnga? ***) (maybe indicating the number of missing folios?)
Numbering in letters on the recto of the folios; after 100, 100 is represented by +. No number on f. 1
Folio numbers 85 and 86 occur on a single page. Folio number 107 occurs twice, being divided in an "upper" (gong ma) and "lower" ('og ma) page. 
Lines per folio: 8; 7 on f. 103a; 5 on f. 107bis-a; 3 on f. 107bis-b
Orthography: 
Bindu for m (e.g., rnaMs)
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myed) (but absent at the end of the manuscript; the change appears to take place at f. 106a)
- Alternative prefix: r- for d- (e.g., rka for dka), sometimes ’a- for m- (e.g., ’thun for mthun)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –l and occasionally  after final –ng, and the form ba occasionally after final –n (e.g., yin ba) 
- Particle tu/du takes the form tu after final –n (e.g., don tu) and du after final –b and final -g
- Final particle po after final –b (e.g., grub po)
- Additional prefix b- (e.g., bskyed par, bsnyon pa)
-  Superabundant ’a rjes ’jug (e.g., brtse’, dpe’)
- Variant orthography (bstan chos for bstan chos; the tsom for the tshom; kun las bstus pa for kun las btus pa; bdag chag for bdag cag; la stsogs for la sogs)
- Occasional reverse i (e.g. 3b5)
- On the last folio (132b), numerous end letters written as subscript; bindu over the tsheg for m in a negation (ma, mi); abbreviations (e.g. for rjes su, phyir ro)
The lemmas from PVin as well as citations of verses and indication of the end of a subsection, seem to have been written in colored ink, maybe by a different hand (but this is not the case at the end of the text).
The folio 107bis seems to be from a different hand and was probably inserted later. There might have been a change of scribe at fol. 106 (palatalization of m is absent from this point onward)
There are significant changes on the last folio (132b) and the last two lines of that folio are written in smaller script, maybe by a different hand.

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Orthography:
- Abundant use of abbreviations (e.g., ye shes, phyag ’tshal lo, gzugs, final –gs, etc.)
- Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin)
Interlinear insertions in smaller script on f. 1b6, f. 2a2 and f. 2a3 (titles for groups of verses) and a few corrections.

dpal mngon par rtogs pa'i bshad pa (colophon)
name: dpal mngon par rtogs pa'i bshad pa
item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Orthography:
- Abbreviations (e.g., for rdo rje, khor lo, sna tshogs, zhes gsungs, sems can, thams cad, final –gs,
etc.)
- Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin)
- lasogs pa and lastsogs pa for la sogs pa
- Frequent spaces, notably after “ni” and before “zhes bya ba” and with the value of shad
- Always a tsheg before shad (or double shad)
Some interlinear additions/corrections (1b1, 1b3, 2b2, 4a3…) in smaller script (dbu can).

relations.label: pramāṇaviniścayaṭīkā (1) (5594) has as an instance gtan tshigs tshul gsum gyi zin bris (5297)

subj.label: pramāṇaviniścayaṭīkā (1) (5594)

obj.label: gtan tshigs tshul gsum gyi zin bris (5297)

comments:
This incomplete manuscript can be identified as No. 16378 in [8H6M69W4], which reports 79 folios, only 34 of which appear in [KUYBGM7V].
As noted in the erratum to [J4L5X9AG], the text in this manuscript corresponds to the portion of Dharmottara's Pramāṇaviniścayaṭīkā (ID:5594), chapter 3, covering fols. 1a-32b in D4227 (with missing portions since fol. 5 and the reproduction of fol. 13 are missing). The version of the text in this manuscript does not significantly differ from that canonical version.
alternative_names: gtan tshigs tshul gsum la sogs gyi zin bris (catalogue)
name: gtan tshigs tshul gsum gyi zin bris
item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Missing folio: 5, 13b.
Orthographic particularities: ya-btags, da-drags, alternance of prefixes (rngos po, dngos po), and the particle pa/ba taking the form ba after final n.
A few glosses are found on the manuscript, some of which report opinions (…zer).

comments:
This item, kept at the Cultural Palace of Nationalities in Beijing (CPN), was discussed in [Q8FCH7LF]: 296. It appears to correspond to a manuscript currently located in the library of Zha lu monastery, see [HMSTSJ7Q]: 468, 306 (zha lu dgon gyi dpe rnying dkar chag):  bka' gdams 4; gzhan gyi phyogs thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba; seng ha shrI; 'bru tsha zhabs ring; 68 x 9 cm. 

The signature is not visible on the cover page of the reproduction in [KUYBGM7V]. It is reported to be "phyi zha 9" in the upper center of the first page in <<van der Kuijp 1993 [Q8FCH7LF]>>: 296. [6TNNKSQ3]: 107 reports the signature "phyi zha 6."
In view of the signature, it was part of the 'Bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang collection. [8H6M69W4] does not list any item with the signature "phyi zha 9." 

The text contains readings that differ from the text in (ID:4770).

rigs pa'i de nyid gsal ba (closing verse)
name: gzhan gyi phyogs thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba (3)
provenance:
'bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang
CPN 4827(1)
zha lu dgon (bka' gdams 4)

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Size: 60.5x10cm.
The text is divided into two columns rather than written in a single line.
Orthography:
- Palatalization of ma (e.g., myi, myed)
- Alternative prefixes (e.g., rngos for dngos, rgos for dgos)
Use of expressions mirroring the Sanskrit (e.g., buta for buddha, bode for bodhi(sattva)

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Most numbers in the left margin are not legible, but it would appear that the cover page corresponds to fol. 25, or that folios are missing between fol. 1 and fol. 26.
Number on the last folio: 121.
Missing folios: 98, 109-112.
Two folios are added between fol. 66 and fol. 67 (re drug 'og ma; re bdun gong ma).
[8H6M69W4], No. 15904, reports 99 folios.
Lines per folio: 8.
Orthography:
Use of bindu for m
- Na for med
- Abbreviations (e.g., for yon tan, la sogs pa, mtshan nyid)
- Numeral used for phonetic value (e.g., for bzhin)
Occasional use of Sanskrit words, e.g. "hetu" for "gtan tshigs" in a verse citation.
Interlinear and marginal glosses.
Proofread.
Some words in large characters appear in the margins (ratna, baidurya).

alternative_names: mdo sde rgyan gyi don bsdus (colophon)
name: mdo sde rgyan gyi don bsdus (1)
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Number on the last folio: 24. No folio with the number 22, but no text appears to be missing between 21b and 23a.
Lines per folio: 10; 11 on fol. 24b.
Orthography:
- Bindu for m
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myes)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form ba after final –n (with some exceptions)
- Particle ba sometimes used for pa (e.g., khyad bar, sgrub ba)
- Frequent reverse i (e.g., 23b3)
- lastsogs and la.sogs for la sogs
- Frequently sdug sngal (in most cases corrected to sdug ‹b›sngal) for sdug bsngal
- Frequent alternative prefix b- for g- (e.g., bzhan for gzhan)
- Enclitic particles (e.g., 'am) written as a separate syllable
- Additional b- prefix (e.g., bsgrub pa)
- Alternative prefix r- instead of d- (e.g., rgos for dgos, rgu for dgu) and 'a- instead of m- (e.g., 'gon po)
- A few abbreviations (e.g. yongs su, tshigs su, grub bo)
There are many scribal mistakes, such as skipped words, as well as dropped prefixes, some of which may reflect older orthography that a subsequent reader corrected, although not systematically. Interlinear annotations (corrections and glosses). A longer insertion on fol. 21b5.

Double numbering of folios, from 1 to 20 (with two consecutive folios numbered "14") and from 148 (100 being represented by an "x") to 168.
The colophon is followed by a sentence in Sanskrit, transcribed in Tibetan script, written by the same hand as the rest of the text.
Proofread once (1 zhus dag go).

relations.label: rgyal ba'i yum kyi bsdus pa'i don (4516) has as an instance rgyal ba'i yum kyi bsdus pa'i don (4515)

subj.label: rgyal ba'i yum kyi bsdus pa'i don (4516)

comments:
The text of the mNgon rtogs rgyan yum bar ma nyi khri dang sbyar ba'i rgyan 'grel (ID:4516) covers fols. 1-158a2. It is followed by a short eulogy to the author (ID:4518) on fol. 158a3-6. 
The title given for No. 19045 in [8H6M69W4] (rtogs dka' mdo'i tshigs don gyi bzhad pa) is taken from the introductory verses. It reports 168 folios (which corresponds to the number on the last folio).
alternative_names:
rtogs dka' mdo'i tshigs don gyi bzhad pa ma lus (introductory verse, catalogue)
rgyal ba'i yum kyi bsdus pa'i don (conclusive verse)
dge slong gzhon nu byang chub kyis mdzad pa'i mngon rtogs rgyan yum bar ma nyi khri dang sbyar ba'i rgyan 'grel
name: rgyal ba'i yum kyi bsdus pa'i don
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Total number of folios: 169. The number on the last folio is 168, but there is an additional folio "nye cig 'og ma" between 21 and 22.
Orthography:
- Palatalization of –m (e.g., myig, myed, dmyigs)
- Superabundant 'a rjes ’jug (e.g., mdo')
- Alternative prefix: r- instead of d- (e.g., rka' for dka')
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –n (e.g., snang pa)
- lasogs pa for la sogs pa
- Bindu for m
- Abbreviations (e.g., for sems can)
- he du (Skt. hetu) instead of the Tibetan gtan tshigs/rtags
Numberous interlinear glosses.

comments:
Incomplete manuscript in cursive script discovered in Khara-Khoto, currently housed in the British Library. 
Plates of the manuscript in <<Takeuchi and Iuchi 2016 [6852GZ36]>>: 537.
Transcription in [H4UUPDCX]: 172-179.
alternative_names: rgyud bla ma'i bsdus don (colophon)
name: rgyud bla ma'i bsdus don
item_description:
See [H4UUPDCX]: 135.
One folio (fol. 2) is extant out of 2 folios. Some words on the verso are illegible.
Lemmata of the base text (verses and auto-commentary) corresponding to the sections being distinguished written as interlinear notes in red ink.
Orthographic particularities:
- palatalization of m (e.g., myed for med)
Work colophon, fol. 2b6: rgyud bla ma'i bsdus don lo tsa ba dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis sbyar pa || ([H4UUPDCX]: 179)

provenance:
'bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang
rgyal rtse dpal 'khor chos sde
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 8; 5 on fol. 21a.
Numbering of folios in letters on the recto.
Folio number on cover page: gcig.
Folio number on last folio: nyes gcig bzhugs so.
Some interlinear notes, long insertion/gloss on fol. 1b7.
Orthography: 
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myi, myed)
- Particle pa/ba takes the form ba after final –n and pa after final –ng and final -l
- Particle kyi/gyi/gi takes the form kyi after final –n and final -l
- Particle tu/du takes the form du after final –b and final -g
- Bindu for final -m
- Reverse i (e.g. at the end of 1b7)
- lastsogs pa, la rtsogs pa and lasogs pa for la sogs pa
- the tsom for the tshom
- bstan chos for bstan bcos
- log par rtogs pa for log par rtog pa
- Superabundant ’a rjes ’jug (e.g., mtho’ ris, dpe’)
- Additional b- prefix (e.g., bsgrub byed)
- A few abbreviations (e.g., for thabs su, sems can and with final particles)
- Alternative prefix ’a- for m- (e.g., ’jug bsdu for mjug bsdu)
- Use of numerals for numbers

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Orthography:
- Palatalization of m (e.g., myin) (not systematic)
- Alternance of prefix: ’a- for m- (e.g. 'thun for mthun)
- Particle tu/du takes the form tu after final n (e.g., kun tu, shin tu)
- Particle gyis/kyis takes the form kyis after final n (e.g., kun kyis)

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Number on the last folio: 161.
Fol. 1 missing.
The numbers 143 and 144 appear on the same folio page. 
Orthography:
- Some abbreviations (e.g., ye shes)
- Bindu for m
Numerous annotations between the lines and in the margins, some in larger characters probably by another hand (e.g., 14b, 17a).

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
No folio number on the first folio; numbering starting with 34 on the second folio (text continuing from the first folio)
Two folios are numbered 39 (so dgu ; so dgu 'og ma). 
Two folios are numbered 168 (brgya re brgyad ; brgya{d} re brgyad 'og).
Numbering in letters on the recto of the folios. 200 is represented by + with a second horizontal stroke, visible from 205 to 209.
Last digit written with a numeral on fols. 111–114, 121–124, 131–133 and 141.
Orthography:
- Bindu for m
- Palatalization of m
- Abbreviations (e.g., for sems can, thams cad, rdo rje, ye shes, etc.)
- Alternative prefix letter 'a for m (e.g., 'gos for mgos, sa 'tshams for sa mtshams)
- Supplementary 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., mthu')
- Character ba frequently written as pa
Numerous interlinear notes (some of which corrections) and marginal glosses.
The words from the base text were probably written in color. Only the vowels appear on the image published in the [ZZVAXS4X].

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 9; 8 on fol. 1b, fol. 2a and fol. 39a.
Orthography:
- Frequent abbreviations (e.g., for bstan bcos, don dam, chen po, final –gs, final particles, etc.)
- Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin, mtshan 4 for mtshan gzhi)
- Space used in the sense of shad (in such cases, the preceding syllable is sometimes not followedby tsheg)
- log rtogs for log rtog
- Additional b- prefixes (e.g., bskyed pa, brgyan)
- Alternative prefix 'a- for m- (e.g., 'thun)
Several interlinear annotations (corrections) in different hands (long notes in dbu can at the bottom of 16b and below 31b3)
Titles on the cover page by two different hands.

comments: The signature above the first line on fol. 1a seems to read "phyi la 588", as reported in [S635TW6P]: 53, but there is no corresponding entry with this signature in the [8H6M69W4]. This instance could correspond to the entry No. 10294 reported with the signature "phyi ma 586", with matching title, author, and number of folios (sher snying gi rgya cher 'grel bzhugs so; shAkya'i dge slong byang chub ye shes kyis; 'bru tsha; 6 f.; 64.5x10.5cm).

name: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i rgya cher 'grel ba (1)
item_description:
Size assuming the identification as No. 10294 is correct.
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 9; 3 on fol. 6b.
Orthography:
- bindu for m
- da drags (6b3: pha rol du phyind pa'i)
- palatalization of ma
- abbreviations (for thams cad, bcu gcig, yon tan, etc.)
- Na for med
- sanskritized words ('bu' ta for sangs rgyas)
- numerals used for numbers
- additional prefix b- (e.g., bsgom pa)
- superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., 'di')
- vertical ligature for d+ng (looking like rng)
- expected ba/bo often written like pa/po
Numerous interlinear annotations (some of which corrections) and marginal annotations.

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Orthography:
- Bindu for m
- Palatalization of m found only in interlinear notes
- Numerals used for numbers
- Abbreviations (e.g., for sems can, ye shes, thams cad…)
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., brtse', bzhi')
- Particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final ng
- bstan chos for bstan bcos
Numerous interlinear annotations (some of which corrections) and marginal annotations. Long addition and commentary on the post-colophon verses in small script at the bottom of the last folio. Other additions in thick ink at the bottom of 63a and of 63b, some in very large characters, some in characters of the same size as the text, written clumsily by a beginner - these seem unrelated to the text.

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha zhabs ring.
Fol. 4 missing.
Orthography:
- Bindu for m
- Occasional palatalization of m (e.g., myed, myi)
- No abbreviations except in additional notes (e.g., for ye shes, ṇa for med)
- Occasional additional prefix b (e.g., bskal pa)
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., mdo'), which have been deleted on the manuscript (some
remaining toward the end of the text)
Numerous interlinear annotations (some of which corrections) and marginal annotations.
Fading ink. Some syllables have been highlighted (maybe with colored ink), e.g., beginning of sections
(gnyis pa, etc.), end of quotations (zhes gsungs), and some entire sentences

provenance: Private collection of Tshul khrims rgyal mtshan
item_description:
Lines per folio: 7; 8 on fol. 4a.
Orthography:
- Palatalization of m (e.g., dmyigs, myed, mying)
pa/ba takes the form ba after final –n (e.g., bstan ba) and often after –s (e.g., thos ba)
- Frequent alternance of pa and ba (which are, further, not always clearly distinguishable)
- tu/du takes the form du after final –g (e.g., mchog du)
- kyi/gyi/gi takes the form gyi after final –b (e.g., shes rab gyi)
- la stsogs pa and la.sogs pa (for la sogs pa) (not systematic)
- log par rtogs pa (for log par rtog pa)
- dam 'cha for dam bca’
- Occasional use of the bindu for m

relations.label: slob dpon zhi ba lha nas brgyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems sbyong ba (4845) has as an instance slob dpon zhi ba lha nas brgyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems sbyong ba (4844)

subj.label: slob dpon zhi ba lha nas brgyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems sbyong ba (4845)

obj.label: slob dpon zhi ba lha nas brgyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems sbyong ba (4844)

comments:
The colophon at the end of the last instruction specifies that the text was written down at the occasion of a teaching by sKyo ston (ID:4052) to Chos kyi rgyal mtshan (ID:6458), without specifying the identity of the scribe. 
The post-colophon annotation identifying the scribe as Chos kyi rgyal mtshan can either refer to this process of writing "in a master copy" (phyag dep dngos la bris) for sKyo ston, but could also refer to a subsequent copy "based on the master copy" (reading: phyag dpe dngos  las bris).

name: slob dpon zhi ba lha nas brgyud pa'i byang chub kyi sems sbyong ba

name: spring pa'i yi ge bdud rtsi thig le
item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Lines per folio: 9 on fols. 1b and 2a; 1 on fol. 2b.
No folio numbers.
Orthography:
- Abbreviations (e.g., for theg chen, bdud rtsi, phyogs su, 'bras bu, sdug bsngal, etc.)
Bindu for m
- Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin)
- Particle pa/ba occasionally takes the form pa after final –ng (phreng pa, snang pa)
- Superabundant 'a rjes ’jug (e.g., dpe')
- laswo for la sogs
Insertions by two different hands, in dbu med (1b4, 2a7) and dbu can (2a1).

comments:

See [S635TW6P]: 62 (bslab btus kyi bsdus don zhig yod kyang shog ldeb gcig las mi 'dug | yang snye mo bye mkhar chos sde dgon du bslab btus kyi 'grel ba dang | spyod 'jug bsdus don | rgyud bla ma'i bsdus don gsum gyi dpe cha sngar yod kyang da lta shog ldeb kha shas las mi 'dug).

item_description:
Scirpt: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 9; 10 on fol. 4a; 7 on fol. 5a.
Orthography:
- Numerals used for numbers 
- Frequent abbreviations (e.g., for thams cad, bcom ldan 'das, etc.)
- Bindu for m
- Always a tsheg before shad (or double shad)

comments:
Blockprint edition based on a single old manuscript original, edited by Klu 'bum dge bshes Shes rab rgya mtsho (1884-1968). Started under the patronage of bKa' drung Padma dbang chen (1894-1917), continued under the patronage of the latter's elder brother dBang chen tshe brtan (1891-1953) and bKra shis dpal 'byor. See [SAF3FTC8] and <<Kano 2016 [BAQ9MH4T]>>: 245.
A reproduction from the Library of Dwags po Rinpoche was published by the Library of Tibetan Works and Archives with an introduction by David Jackson ([WXQG3639]).
First chapter edited in [TBWSNAM6].

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Lines per folio: 8; 2 on fol. 6b.
Numbering in letters in the left margin from fol. 2,
Number on fol. 6: drug yod.
Orthography: spelling rka for dka'.
Interlinear notes consisting in lemmas referring to the base text. A few corrections. Some longer marginal notes on fol. 1b and 2a.
Seemingly unrelated note (only partly legible) on the cover page and note "sgron me rin chen"  in the right margin.

item_description:
Script: dbu med.
Lines per folio: 7; 4 on fol. 40a.
The cover page has a handwritten note referring to three dGe lugs pa works, and has no relevance to the contents of the manuscript (See [BAQ9MH4T]: 244).
Orthography:
- Frequent palatalization of m (but not systematic)
- bstan chos for bstan bcos
- sdug sngal for sdug bsngal
- phun sum 'tshogs for phun sum tshogs (sometimes corrected by the deletion of a-chung)
- las sogs for la sogs
- Particle pa/ba takes the form ba after final –n, and pa after final –l and final -ng
- Enclitic particles occur sometimes as separate syllables ('khor lo 'o, kho na 'o, ’khor lo ’i)
- Alternance of prefix b- and g- (e.g., both rnam par gzhag, rnam par bzhag are found)
- Additional prefix b- (e.g., bsgrub)
Occasional interlinear additions (corrections). Long insertion on fol. 11a.

item_description:
Script: dbu can.
Folio numbering with letters (ka, kha...). Additionally, on the last folio (Hu): drug bcu rtsa dgu bzhugs so.
The colophon is followed by a list of six scholars written in the same script than the rest of the text, with an annotation for each, which seems to indicate a lineage, with three unknown figures following Zhang tshes spong (ID:3805): ex01112025-05-0716-39-23

comments:
Although the colophon ascribes the word to Blo gros mtshungs med (ID:3896), it is identified as a work by Klong chen rab 'byams pa (ID:6062) in BUDA (bdr:MW25983).
The text is the same as in instance (ID:4587), with a modern addition in the colophon (see [BAQ9MH4T]: n. 149). The colophon is followed by a modern eulogy to Blo gros mtshungs med by sMin gling gter chen 'gyur med rdo rje.

The reproduction in [Z5AUD7GQ] is the same as the one that appeared in 1974 in [BXCBT3S8]. This is a handwritten copy of an ancient manuscript from the library of Ri bo che rje drung, preserving the old orthography, and the abbreviations (bsdu yig).
alternative_names: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma'i bstan bcos kyi nges don gsal byed pa rin po che (cover page, incipit, colophon)
name: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma'i bstan bcos kyi nges don gsal byed pa rin po che'i sgron me (2)
item_description:
The recto and verso of folios are numbered with printed Arabic numbers from 1 to 682.
In the incipit, a dot is written under the main syllables from the title - forming the contracted title "rgyud bla ma'i bstan bcos nges don gsal bar byed rin po che'i sgron me." The word "kyang" on l. 5 likewise is underlined with a dot, as is the name o the author "blo gros" on 4.5. Lemmata from the base text are similarly marked.

item_description: Modern typeset edition based on an unknown manuscript written by "seng ge" (ID:6834). "seng ge" could be the scribe of the first written copy rather than that of this instance, as his name is mentioned along with the place of composition of the work (dpal sa skya'i chos gwa chen po), whereas another place of scribing (dpal ldan yang dgon) is given after the lineage.

comments:
Incomplete manuscript. 208 folios are extant (number on the last folio: 217) and the text stops abruptly.
It is unclear whether this manuscript corresponds to either No. 15939 or No. 15940 [8H6M69W4], with this title and signature.
[8H6M69W4] reports 142 folios for No. 15940 (author: blo gros rgyal mtshan; 45 x 7.6 cm) and 117 folios for No. 15939 (author: paNDi ta 'jam dbyangs blo gros kyis; 44 x 9 cm.).
The latter is more likely as this is the name of the author found in the other instance (ID:5488).

comments:
Among the items with signature "phyi zha 21" listed in [8H6M69W4], this instance could correspond to No. 16375. [8H6M69W4] reports 106 folios, which corresponds to the folio number on the last folio of this 32-folio instance. 
However, [8H6M69W4] reports for No. 16375 the title "tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i Tik+ka las rang don le'u," the author "ye shes dpal ste chos kyi ye shes min nam snyam brtag," and the script "dpe tshugs," size "61.5 x 8 cm" whereas the present instance bears no indication of authorship and the contents relate, rather, to the first chapter of the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774). The first words on fol. 75a - di las rang don le'ur bstan pa'i... - could have influenced the editors of [8H6M69W4].

name: tshad ma'i bsdus pa

item_description:
No title visible on the cover page.
The title in the incipit was originally written in color and appears faded in the black and white  reproduction.
Missing folios: 13-18 (in the middle of the chapter on direct perception).
Annotation on the cover page: 2(89).
Lines/folio: 8.
Change of script style in the later half of the text.
Standard conjuncts and abbreviations.
Numerals either written out in full with letters or as a number; used for phonetic value (i.e., 4n for bzhin).
Retroflex n for med.
See [CTQMVBPR]: 36-39.

Contains glosses that name the individuals referred to as "kha cig"/"kha cig na re" ([5IPSARNF]: lcii). Mentioned are for instance (with their tentative identification): sa (ID:3892), rngog (ID:3786), phya (ID:3831), dan (ID:3840), rtsang (ID:3839), 'jam gsar (ID:3884), skyal (ID:4020), khro po (for Khro phu? (ID:3878)), khyung (ID:3809), ye 'bar (according to Schwabland (ID:3825), more likely (ID:4264)), nag (ID:6340).

comments:

Manuscript in handwritten capital script used along with instance (ID: 6118) for the  edition in [2QJBN2UX], originally housed in the Central Tibetan monastery of Thub bstan rdo rje brag founded around the 1620s by Byang bdag Rig 'dzin Ngag gi dbang po (1580-1639), than at the Potala in Lhasa. 
The instance seems to corresponds to a 196-folio manuscript listed in a catalogue of works by authors connected to the rNying ma school ([UUE853RL]: 7, No. 01225 "bris par pod bzhi pa" (4)).

subj.label: tshad ma'i de kho na nyid bsdus pa (5507)

obj.label: tshad ma'i de kho na nyid bsdus pa (3) (5506)

comments:
Typeset edition in book format based on instances (ID:6116) and (ID:6117) (see the editorial introduction in [2QJBN2UX]: 2, [FZ6N88AU]: 389, and <<Stoltz 2020 [MGPRHX73]>>: 49).
Van der Kuijp notes that the two instances possibly go back to the same ancestor as they share the same lacuna on [2QJBN2UX]: 143 (noted in the edition: "ma dpe las chad"). A portion of the text also seems missing on p. 39 and on p. 51. They also seem to have shared lexical and orthographic features, e.g., writing "'bu ta" rather than "sangs rgyas," "he du" for "gtan tshigs," and "dar ma kir ti" for "chos kyi grags pa."
name: tshad ma'i de kho na nyid bsdus pa (3)

item_description:
Script: dpe tshugs.
Lines per folio: 9.
No tsheg before shad, and occasionally absent between syllables (e.g., yinte for yin te, tshangbang for tshang bang)
Use of da-drags (e.g., phyird, thald, bsald)
Alternance of prefixes (e.g., 'thun/mthun, bgod/'god)
Abbreviations (ṇa for med)
Some Sanskrit words used instead of their Tibetan equivalent (e.g., lo ga instead of 'jig rten, he du instead of gtan tshigs)

Cover page: ex44032023-07-2514-44-07

relations.label: tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk+ka blo gsal mgul rgyan (4769) has as an instance tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk+ka blo gsal mgul rgyan (4768)

obj.label: tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk+ka blo gsal mgul rgyan (4768)

comments:
The <<bKa' gdams gsung 'bum dkar chag [Z5WBK2VV]>>: 64 reports the signature "phyi zha 21" but no signature is visible on the images in the bKa' gdams gsung 'bum reproduction.
<<Hugon 2021 [J4L5X9AG]>> tentatively identified this item with no. 16376 in the <<'Bras spungs dkar chag [8H6M69W4]>> (phyi zha 21, dpe tshugs, 61.5x8cm, 102ff., tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i Tik+ka las mngon sum le'u bzhugs so, ne'u thog pa chos kyi bla ma'i slob ma chos kyi ye shes yin nam snyam).
However, No. 16376 seems to represent the first chapter of a work whose second chapter is listed as No. 16375 (phyi zha 21, dpe tshugs, 61.5x8cm, 106 ff., tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i Tik+ka las rang don le'u bzhugs so, ye shes dpal ste chos kyi ye shes min nam snyam brtag) (see respectively (ID:6014) and (ID:6013)), whereas the instance under consideration contains a commentary on all three chapters of the Pramāṇaviniścaya. No corresponding entry could be located in the [8H6M69W4].
name: tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk+ka blo gsal mgul rgyan
item_description:
First folio missing. 
Folio number on the last folio: 102.

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Folio number on last folio (13a): bcu gsum bzhugs so.
Lines per folio: 8; 4 on fol. 13b.
Orthography:
- A few inverted i-s
- Some cases of palatalization
- Occasional alternation of prefixes (e.g., rngos for dngos, ’thun for mthun)
Interlinear insertions (lemmas of PVin). Abundant marginal and interlinear notes (glosses, additional or alternative subdivisions).
Proofread.

item_description:
Number 48 occurs twice (upper/lower). 
Change of hand from fol. 29.
Miniatures of Dignāga and bCom ldan ral gri on fol. 1b.
Base text written in red ink. Items of the topical outline and quotations in dark red and yellow ink.
The final portion of the colophon cannot be read.
Contains numerous glosses, beginning on fol. 6a and ending on fol. 61a.

comments:
The size of the folios and number of lines per folio is identical to that of the manuscript of Phya pa's Tshad ma yid kyi mun sel (ID:4502), which has the same signature. The handwriting of the two manuscripts is similar, but the orthographic particularities are not identical.
There are two sets of images for this manuscript, which differ in legibility.

item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 9; 3 on fol. 197a.
Numbering in letters on the recto of the folios, from fol. 2
Some insertions (corrections).
Orthography:
- Frequent use of the bindu for final –m
- Abbreviations (e.g., for thams cad)
- Alternative spelling (e.g., the tsom)
- Palatalization of ma by ya btags
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug

item_description:
Annotation on the cover page: 2(148).
Number on the last folio: 152. 
No folio is missing, but the scribe skipped 54 when numbering the folios. Further, fols. 71 and 72 occur on the same page, so do fols. 84 and 85 and fols. 147 and 148.
Lines per folio: 7.
Contains only few glosses, which do not identify individuals whose views are being referred to.
The end of the colophon is written in dbu can below l. 8 on fol. 152a.

This item appears to correspond to a manuscript currently located in the library of Zha lu monastery, although its catalogue reports 102 folios. [HMSTSJ7Q]: 468, No. 307 (zha lu dgon gyi dpe rnying dkar chag):  bka' gdams 5; tshad ma rnam nges kyi Tik; gtsang chu mig pa seng ge dpal; 'bru tsha zhabs ring; 69 x 9 cm.

The colophon indicating the place of writing as Yar lungs khra 'brug gi gtsug lag khang is likely that of the conjectured first instance of the work (ID:5869). 
Images of fols. 75b and 89a are lacking in [KUYBGM7V] but are present in the images of BDRC MW1CZ2155, which give access to 150 folios. The note on the cover page of the CPN exemplar reports 149 folios.

In view of the signature, the manuscript was part of the 'Bras spungs gnas bcu lha khang collection. [8H6M69W4] does not list any item with the signature "phyi zha 9."

item_description:
Indigenous catalogue marking in red ink "ka."
Some parts of the texts are marked in yellow, or underlined in red.
Script: 'bru tsha
Lines per folio: 8
Folio numbering with numbers written in letters. From 100, number 100 is written as "+"; from 200, number 200 is written as "≠".
Orthography: 
- Frequent abbreviations (e.g., for mngon sum, thams cad, etc.)
- Frequent superabundant suffix –'a (e.g., dbye', brda', gzhi')
- Frequent absence of g- prefixes (e.g., cig for gcig, sum for gsum)
- Alternative initial prefix (e.g., rngos or sngos for dngos)
- Bindu for m
- Alternative spelling (spyad for dpyad; spyod for dpyod; the tsom for the tshom)
- tsheg always present before shad (or double shad)

Cover page: ex1301_20072023-06-281

comments:
There are two sets of images for this manuscript, which differ in legibility ([QW2VZ9RN]: 171). The signature is visible on one of them only.
The <<'Bras spungs dkar chag [8H6M69W4]>> reports 96 folios for entry no. 16329 (this corresponds to the folio number on the last folio).

The size of the folios and number of lines per folio is identical to that of the manuscript of Phya pa's Tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad shes rab kyi 'od zer (ID:4500), which has the same signature. The handwriting is similar, but the orthographic particularities are not identical.

tshad ma yid kyi mun pa sel ba (incipit, colophon, chapter colophons)
yid kyi mun sel (conclusive verse)
name: tshad ma yid kyi mun sel (1)
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
Lines per folio: 9; 8 on fol. 28b; 10 on fol. 57b; 4 on fol. 96a.
Numbering in letters on the recto of the folios, from 2 to 96. 
Folio number on last folio: go drug bzhugs s+ho.
An additional folio numbered "nyer brgyad gong ma" (upper 28) occurs between fol. 27 and fol. 28. 
Images of folios 87a and 86b are misplaced in the [Z5AUD7GQ]. They appear in the following order: 86a (p. 606), 87b (p. 607), 87a (p. 608), 86b (p. 609), 88a (p. 610).
Orthography:
- Palatalization of ma by ya btags (frequent on the first folio, rare afterwards)
- Superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (ex. gzhi', dbyeʾ)
- Flexible use of prefixes for verbal forms and their derivatives: sgrub bya/bsgrub bya, sgrub pa/bsgrub pa, gzung bya/bzung bya, gzung don/bzung don, gzung yul/bzung yul, gcad pa'i yul can/bcad paʾi yul can
- The la don takes the form du after final –b (ex. kun rdzob du, rab du dbye ba) and final –g (ex. cig du)
-  The particle pa/ba takes the form pa after final –ng (ex. mthong pa, snang pa) and final – l (ex. sel pa, but one sometimes finds ʾkhrul ba in alternance with 'khrul pa)
- Different spelling used alternatively for some words (ex. cig or gcig, the tsom or the tshom)
- Spelling differing from classical Tibetan, used consistently: log rtogs (for log rtog), rkang thil (for rkang mthil)
- la sogs pa consistently spelled lasogs pa
- Enclitics ('ang, 'am, 'i, 'o) frequently appear as a separate syllable
- Consistent use of the tsheg before a shad.
- Use of the bindu instead of final ma (especially in insertions)
- Character ṇa for med (rare)
- Use of the reverse i (gigu log) (rare, ex. 3b8: 'di'ï, 6b2 ngo bo cïg, 6b2 po'ï)
- Use of numerals for numbers (ex. 2 for gnyis) or for their phonetic value (ex. skad 1 for skad cig)
Insertions below the line or in the top/bottom margins (mostly corrections; some additional glosses)

item_description:
Script: dbu can (typeset).
Numbering of the folios in letters in the left margin on the recto.
In the left margin on the verso: mdo sdud pa'i 'grel pa.

alternative_names:
yum bar ma nyi khri’i rnam bshad (cover page)
rgyal ba'i yum bar ma le'u brgyad pa nyi khri lnga stong ba mdo' 'grel rnam par bshad pa (colophon)
name: yum bar ma nyi khri'i rnam bshad (1)
item_description:
Script: 'bru tsha.
No visible number on f. 1
Numbering in letters on the recto of the other folios
Folio number on last folio: rgya so bzhi bzhug so
Folio 82 in the handwriting of the main scribe occurs twice in [Z5AUD7GQ]: on pp. 493–494 and again on 497–498.
A folio also numbered 82, in a different handwriting (as f. 23 and 42 and 134) but with the same content (in a slightly different pagination) appears on pp. 495–496.
F. 84 on pp. 501–502 is misplaced in the BUDA images  between the pages numbered p. 528 and 529.
F. 85 on pp. 503–504 is misplaced in the BUDA images between the pages numbered p. 524 and 525.
Orthography:
- A few abbreviations (for yon tan, thams cad, slob dpon, ye shes)
- Bindu for m
- Supplementary a rjes 'jug (e.g., mdo')
Numerous interlinear and marginal glosses, some of which appear to report the teaching of rNgog Blo ldan shes rab.
